text: Nouadhibou (; , Berber: Nwadibu, formerly in French: ) is the second-biggest city in Mauritania. It is the capital of the Dahklet Nouadhibou Region. ==History== The town was first made as a small fishing port. It was owned by the Portuguese, then the Dutch, and then the French.Wilaya de Dakhlet Nouadhibou , Garde Nationale ===Population history=== ==Health== The Nouadhibou Regional Hospital was opened in 2017. It took five years to make it. It is the biggest hospital in the area. ==References== Category:Cities in Mauritania
title: Nouadhibou
